name: Packaging Dynamics
overview: Packaging Dynamics Corporation manufactures flexible packaging and specialty papers. The company operates in three units: Thilmany Papers, BagcraftPapercon, and International Converter. The Thilmany Papers unit offers specialty bleached and unbleached lightweight paper products, such as sandwich wraps, box closure taping systems, insulation backing, microwave popcorn bags, confectionary cups, and medical drapes and steel interleavers. It also provides pressure sensitive release base papers to provide backing for self-adhesive materials, including business/consumer labels, airline baggage tags, food and consumer ID labels, industrial tapes and sealants, feminine hygiene, medical products, and laser and inkjet applications. This unit has paper mills in De Pere and Kaukuana, Wisconsin. It also produces paper machines for other manufacturers in Jay, Maine. The BagcraftPapercon unit converts paper, film, and foil into various specialty food packaging products, including specialty bags, sheets, wraps, interfolded tissues, and pan liners, as well as butcher, freezer, and locker paper products. It has facilities in Illinois, Iowa, Kansas, Georgia, and California. The International Converter unit produces adhesive and film extrusion laminations, such as base stock materials that are used in the production of labels, bags, pouches, composite cans, lidding, and blister packaging. It also produces facing materials that are used by the building materials companies in producing insulation products in North America and Europe. This unit has facilities in Ohio, Mississippi, and Wisconsin. Packaging Dynamics Corporationâ€™s products are used in food and non-food packaging, consumer, medical, foodservice distribution, supermarket, bakery, restaurant, packer processor, retail, and industrial packaging applications. The company was founded in 1998 and is headquartered in Chicago, Illinois. As of June 9, 2006, Packaging Dynamics Corporation operates as a subsidiary of Thilmany, LLC.
